column4: ok .. i wanna shutdown X ... coz i wont be able to start up gnome correctly now. i'm at the login prmopt, graphical that is
jowi: i end up at an empty brown screen... :)
ok
nice facts about ubuntu on iMac: you cant tab-complete commands on the keyboard
ok i stopped gdm .. i am at a normal console login thing now
i will do the net-command
wtf ?
jowi: ok then thats not an alternative really
so i cant apt-get it
isnt there a way to apt-get instal gnome panel from the cd i have ?
: are you using a ppp connexion (modem) or LAN ?
small network at home, a router, a switch. computers behind the switch can have static IPs or be DHCP'd. This ubuntu box had DHCP settings
: francais ?
non, suedois
depuis naissance
: do you have a line like this in dhclient output ? : 'execve (/sbin/dhclient-script, ...): No such file or directory'
nope it doesnt complain about that script
then try 'sudo iptables -F' and 'sudo dhclient eth0' (without sudo if root of course)
so you know the ip of your router ?
yeah i know the IP of the router
uhm.. yeah that should be it .. or 192.168.1.1   ... can never remember  :)
: then you can try 'ifconfig eth0 192.168.1.199 netmask 255.255.255.0 up'
is that all there is to getting a static IP on a *nix machine ?
